name: Malay Beehoon
recipeIngredient: 115 g mustard greens or pak choi (shredded),
225 g dried rice vermicelli (soaked in lukewarm water until pliable and drained),
4 dried red chilies (soaked until soft and deseeded),
25 g fresh root ginger (peeled and chopped),
recipeInstructions: 1. Combine the ingredients for the rempah in a mortar and pestle or food processor into a paste.
2. In a wok fry off the rempah in a little oil until it begins to colour and becomes fragrant.
3. Toss in the carrots and cook for a few minutes.
5. Add the stock and soy sauce and cook for 1 minute.
6. Add the beansprouts and mustard greens.
8. Toss well to ensure the vegetables and noodles are coated and heated through.
9. Transfer to a serving plate and garnish with the sliced chilies and coriander.
